definitions.example: Be sure to finish your homework before you go to bed!

definitions.definition: To apply a treatment to (a surface or similar).
definitions.example: The furniture was finished in teak veneer.

definitions.definition: To change an animal's food supply in the months before it is due for slaughter, with the intention of fattening the animal.
definitions.example: Due to BSE, cows in the United Kingdom must be finished and slaughtered before 30 months of age.
We had to leave before the concert had finished.

definitions.definition: To put an end to; to destroy.
definitions.example: These rumours could finish your career.
That guy's a slow and lazy player, but he's got excellent finishing

definitions.definition: The final work upon or ornamentation of a thing; finish.
